name: Word Search4 Trivia Game | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: The Percheron, a compact heavy breed of carthorse, discovers the wading bird?
questions.explanation:
Heron & heron.

	percHERON. The heron is the wading bird.

questions.text: Preachers at beaches are a source of a continuous dull pain?
questions.explanation:
Ache & ache.

	preACHErs or beACHEs. Ache is the dull pain.

questions.text: Can the male reproductive organ of a flower be found in the New Testament?
questions.explanation:
Stamen & stamen.

	teSTAMENt. The male reproductive organ of a flower is the stamen.

questions.text: Not sure if the lady from the New Hebrides has just been or is about to be married?
questions.explanation:
Bride & bride.

	heBRIDEs. Bride is the lady to be married.

questions.text: An Eminem single is a constant pain?
questions.explanation:
Stan & stan.

	conSTANt. 'Stan' was the name of the Eminem single.

questions.text: A knight of the road is a man distinguished by exceptional courage, nobility or fortitude?
questions.explanation:
Hero & hero.

	tHE ROad. A man distinguished by exceptional courage, nobility or fortitude is a hero.

questions.text: The Norwegian pop group is from Omaha, Nebraska?
questions.explanation:
Aha & aha.

	omAHA. The Norwegian pop group is A-HA.

questions.text: You can find a Jerusalem artichoke at an event at which goods are sold at reduced prices?
questions.explanation:
Sale & sale & Mart & mart.

	jeruSALEm. A sale is where goods are sold at reduced prices. Thanks to Iains, mart is also correct. jerusaleM ARTichoke.

questions.text: Is a tiger moth a microorganism?
questions.explanation:
Germ & germ.

	tiGER Moth. A germ is a microorganism.

questions.text: A humorous or jocular person sits inside the station wagon?
questions.explanation:
Wag & wag.

	WAGon. A wag is a humorous or jocular person.

questions.text: Camouflage can cause you to become weak or tired?
questions.explanation:
Flag & flag.

	camouFLAGe. Flag is to become weak or tired.

questions.text: The Andean condor is the chief administrative official of a college or university?
questions.explanation:
Dean & dean.

	anDEAN. The chief administrative official of a college or university is called the dean.

questions.text: A lavish or formal social function for dancing is enjoyed by Dr. Hannibal Lecter?
questions.explanation:
Ball & ball.

	hanniBAL Lecter. A lavish or formal social function for dancing is called a ball.

questions.text: If you like a fountain to be ornamental, so be it?
questions.explanation:
Amen & amen & Into & into.

	ornAMENtal. Amen means 'so be it'. Alan-SouthAust suggested the word 'into' from 'If you like ...'. Well done that man.

questions.text: Are the most powerful, rich and gifted the Hebrews, Romans or the Israelites?
questions.explanation:
Elite & elite.

	israELITEs. The elite are the most powerful, rich and gifted.

questions.text: The French city with a Roman amphitheatre can be found in Charleston, West Virginia?
questions.explanation:
Arles & arles.

	chARLESton. Arles is the French city with the Roman amphitheatre.

questions.text: The British Empire is home to the eldest of Noah's three sons?
questions.explanation:
Shem & shem.

	britiSH EMpire. Noah's eldest son was called Shem.

questions.text: Which of the Seven Wonders of the World is malleable and gives little or no resistance to pressure or weight?
questions.explanation:
Soft & soft.

	wonderS OF The. If something is malleable and gives little or no resistance to pressure or weight it is soft.

questions.text: Are the Netherlands the upper regions of the atmosphere, clear sky or heaven in Greek Mythology?
questions.explanation:
Ether & ether.

	nETHERlands. Ether is the upper regions of the atmosphere, clear sky or heaven in Greek Mythology.

questions.text: A characteristic feature of a straitjacket?
questions.explanation:
Trait & trait.

	sTRAITjacket.A trait is a characteristic feature.

questions.text: A unit of work or energy is only used in emergency?
questions.explanation:
Erg & erg.

	emERGency. An erg is a unit of work or energy.

questions.text: Marlene Dietrich is head of the legislative assembly in Japan?
questions.explanation:
Diet & diet.

	DIETrich. Diet is the legislative assembly in Japan.

questions.text: If I add an acid to an alcohol and eliminate water, will I end up with Lester Bowles Pearson?
questions.explanation:
Ester & ester.

	lESTER. In chemistry, an acid and an alcohol gives an ester and water. Lester Bowles Pearson was a former prime minister of Canada (1963-68)

questions.text: Malarial fever can be found at 'Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea'?
questions.explanation:
Ague & ague.

	LeAGUEs. Ague is malarial fever.

questions.text: The dish named after the German bacteriologist is found using an Indian rope-trick?
questions.explanation:
Petri & petri.

	roPE TRIck. The Petri dish is named after J. R. Petri (1852-1921) a German bacteriologist. Hope you enjoyed the quiz. If you find an alternative answer like many players have in other games, please let me know and these will be added to the correct answer list. Cheers.
